name: Turtle Rock
description: A striking geological formation in Joshua Tree National Park, Turtle Rock is a favorite among rock climbers and nature enthusiasts. Its smooth, weathered surface resembles the shell of a turtle, offering breathtaking views of the desert landscape. The surrounding trails are ideal for hiking and photography.

name: Silver Salmon Creek
park: Lake Clark National Park and Preserve
description: Nestled within the rugged beauty of Lake Clark National Park, Silver Salmon Creek is a haven for wildlife. Visitors often spot brown bears fishing for salmon along its banks. The creek is also a popular spot for kayaking and nature photography.

name: Chilkoot Trail
park: Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park
description: This historic trail played a pivotal role during the Klondike Gold Rush, serving as a key passage for prospectors. Today, the Chilkoot Trail offers a challenging but rewarding hike through lush forests, alpine landscapes, and remnants of gold rush history.

name: St. Mary Lake
description: Known for its crystal-clear waters and stunning mountain backdrop, St. Mary Lake is the second-largest lake in Glacier National Park. Its scenic surroundings and iconic Wild Goose Island make it a must-see destination for photographers and nature lovers.

name: Twin Lake
park: Lake Clark National Park and Preserve
description: Surrounded by dramatic peaks, Twin Lake is a serene spot for fishing, canoeing, and hiking. Its pristine waters and remote location offer visitors a tranquil escape in the heart of Alaska's wilderness.

name: Lake McDonald
description: The largest lake in Glacier National Park, Lake McDonald boasts vibrant reflections of its surrounding mountains and forests. Its colorful pebble-strewn shorelines are iconic, making it a favorite for photographers and families alike.

name: Charley Rivers
description: Winding through Alaska's remote wilderness, Charley Rivers offers a unique opportunity to experience unspoiled landscapes. Its crystal-clear waters and surrounding boreal forests are home to diverse wildlife, including moose, bears, and migratory birds.

name: Icy Bay
park: Wrangell-St. Elias National Park and Preserve
description: A stunning glacial bay in Wrangell-St. Elias National Park, Icy Bay is characterized by its massive icebergs and breathtaking views. Visitors can explore its fjords by kayak or take guided boat tours to observe glaciers up close.

name: Rainbow Lake
description: A small but picturesque lake, Rainbow Lake is a hidden gem for fishing and birdwatching. Its calm waters and surrounding forest create a peaceful retreat for visitors seeking solitude.

name: Hidden Lake
description: Tucked away in North Cascades National Park, Hidden Lake is a reward for adventurous hikers. Its turquoise waters and surrounding alpine meadows make it a breathtaking destination for those willing to traverse its challenging trails.

name: Chincoteague
description: Located in the Chincoteague National Wildlife Refuge, this river is known for its serene beauty and thriving ecosystem. The area is famous for its wild ponies, birdwatching opportunities, and scenic waterways.

name: Lake Umbagog
description: Straddling the border of New Hampshire and Maine, Lake Umbagog is a quiet retreat for canoeing, fishing, and camping. Its lush surroundings and calm waters make it a favorite for nature lovers and outdoor adventurers.
